stress_test Package¶

common Module¶

Reusable functions for stress tests

stress_test.common.check_ds_hosts(controller_ip, controller_restconf_port, auth_token)[source]¶

Query number of hosts registered in ODL operational DS

Parameters:
  • controller_ip – controller IP address
  • controller_restconf_port – controller restconf port
  • auth_token – tuple with controller restconf user and password

(controller_restconf_user, controller_restconf_password) :returns: number of hosts found, 0 if none exists and -1 in case of error. :rtype: int :type controller_ip: str :type controller_restconf_port: int :type auth_token: tuple<str>

stress_test.common.check_ds_links(controller_ip, controller_restconf_port, auth_token)[source]¶

Query number of links registered in ODL operational DS

Parameters:
  • controller_ip – controller IP address
  • controller_restconf_port – controller restconf port
  • auth_token – tuple with controller restconf user and password

(controller_restconf_user, controller_restconf_password) :returns: number of links found, 0 if none exists and -1 in case of error. :rtype: int :type controller_ip: str :type controller_restconf_port: int :type auth_token: tuple<str>

stress_test.common.check_ds_switches(controller_ip, controller_restconf_port, auth_token)[source]¶

Query number of switches registered in ODL operational DS

Parameters:
  • controller_ip – controller IP address
  • controller_restconf_port – controller restconf port
  • auth_token – tuple with controller restconf user and password

(controller_restconf_user, controller_restconf_password) :returns: number of switches found, 0 if none exists and -1 in case of error. :rtype: int :type controller_ip: str :type controller_restconf_port: int :type auth_token: tuple<str>

stress_test.common.create_cpu_shares(controller_cpu_shares, generator_cpu_shares)[source]¶

Returns a tuple of 2 strings, in which we have the controller and generator CPU shares as a comma separated values.

Parameters:controller_cpu_shares – Percentage of CPU resources to be used by

controller. :param generator_cpu_shares: Percentage of CPU resources to be used by generator. :type controller_cpu_shares: int :type generator_cpu_shares: int

stress_test.common.poll_ds_thread(controller_ip, controller_restconf_port, controller_restconf_auth_token, boot_start_time, expected_switches, discovery_deadline_ms, queuecomm)[source]¶

Poll operational DS to discover installed switches

Parameters:
  • controller_ip – controller IP address
  • controller_restconf_port – controller restconf port
  • auth_token – tuple with controller restconf user and controller

restconf password (controller_restconf_user, controller_restconf_password) :param boot_start_time: The time we begin starting topology switches :param expected_switches: switches expected to find in the DS :param discovery_deadline_ms: deadline (in ms) at which the thread should discover switches (in milliseconds) :param queuecomm: queue for communicating with the main context :type controller_ip: str :type controller_restconf_port: int :type controller_restconf_auth_token: tuple<str> :type boot_start_time: int :type expected_switches: int :type discovery_deadline_ms: float :type queuecomm: multiprocessing.Queue

stress_test.common.sample_stats(cpid)[source]¶

Take runtime statistics

Parameters:cpid (int) – controller PID
Returns:the statistics in a dictionary
Return type:dict

controller_utils Module¶

Reusable functions for processes that are controller related

stress_test.controller_utils.check_controller_status(controller_status_handler)[source]¶

Wrapper to the controller status handler

Parameters:controller_status_handler (str) – filepath to the controller status handler
Returns:‘1’ if controller is active, ‘0’ otherwise
Return type:str

 When another process Listens on controller’s port.

stress_test.controller_utils.restart_controller(controller_stop_handler, controller_start_handler, controller_status_handler, controller_port, old_cpid, controller_cpus_str)[source]¶

Restarts the controller

Parameters:
  • controller_start – filepath to the controller start handler
  • controller_status – filepath to the controller status handler
  • controller_stop – filepath to the controller stop handler
  • controller_port – controller port number to listen for SB connections
  • old_cpid – PID of already running controller process
  • controller_cpus_str – controller CPU share as a strin containing

the values of shares, separated with comma :returns: controller process ID :rtype: int :type controller_start: str :type controller_status: str :type controller_stop: str :type controller_port: int :type old_cpid: int :type controller_cpus_str: str

stress_test.controller_utils.start_controller(controller_start_handler, controller_status_handler, controller_port, controller_cpus_str)[source]¶

Wrapper to the controller start handler

Parameters:
  • controller_start_handler – filepath to the controller start handler
  • controller_status_handler – filepath to the controller status handler
  • controller_port – controller port number to listen for SB connections
  • controller_cpus_str – controller CPU share as a strin containing

the values of shares, separated with coma :returns: controller’s process ID :raises Exception: When controller fails to start. :rtype: int :type controller_start_handler: str :type controller_status_handler: str :type controller_port: int :type controller_cpus_str: str

Wrapper to the controller stop handler

Parameters:
  • controller_stop_handler (str) – filepath to the controller stop handler
  • controller_status_handler (str) – filepath to the controller status handler
  • cpid (int) – controller process ID
stress_test.controller_utils.wait_until_controller_listens(interval_ms, port)[source]¶

Waits for the controller to start listening on specified port.

Parameters:
  • interval_ms – milliseconds to wait (in milliseconds).
  • port – controller port.
Raises Exception:
 

If controller fails to start or if another process

listens on controllers port. :returns: on success, returns the controller pid. :rtype int :type interval_ms: int :type port: int

stress_test.controller_utils.wait_until_controller_up_and_running(interval_ms, controller_status_handler)[source]¶

Waits for the controller status to become 1 (Started).

Parameters:
  • interval_ms – milliseconds to wait (in milliseconds).
  • controller_status_handler – filepath to the controller status handler
Raises Exception:
 

If controller fails to start or if another process

listens on controllers port. :type interval_ms: int :type controller_status_handler: str

Collects and prints statistics information about all installed flows for all the nodes of the topology

Bases: object

Helper object used to add and remove flows based on predefined templates.

add_flow(flow_id, node_id, ip_dest)[source]¶

Adds a flow to the specified node

Parameters:
  • flow_id – ID of the flow to add
  • node_id – ID of the node to which we will add the flow
  • ip_dest – IP address to populate the destination IP field of the

flow template :returns: status code for the http call issued :rtype: int :type flow_id: int :type node_id: int :type ip_dest: str

remove_flow(flow_id, node_id)[source]¶

Removes a flow from the specified node

Parameters:
  • flow_id (int) – ID of the flow to remove
  • node_id (int) – ID of the node from which the flow will be removed

status code for the http call issued

generator_utils Module¶

Reusable functions for processes that are generator related

stress_test.generator_utils.cleanup_generator(generator_clean_handler)[source]¶

Shuts down the Generator.

Parameters:generator_clean_handler – Filepath to the handler that cleanup the

generator. :type generator_clean_handler: str

stress_test.generator_utils.generator_thread(generator_run_handler, generator_cpus, controller_ip, controller_port, threads, sw_per_thread, switches, thr_delay_ms, traf_delay_ms, ms_per_test, internal_repeats, hosts, warmup, mode, data_queue=None, succ_msg='', fail_msg='')[source]¶

Function executed by generator thread.

Parameters:
  • generator_run_handler – generator run handler
  • generator_cpus – Cpu ids we assign to generator thread
  • controller_ip – controller IP
  • controller_port – controller port
  • threads – number of generator threads
  • sw_per_thread – number of switches per thread
  • switches – number of total switches
  • thr_delay – delay between thread creation
  • traf_delay – delay between last thread creation and traffic

transmission :param ms_per_test: test duration of a single generator loop :param internal_repeats: number of generator loops :param hosts: number of simulated hoss :param warmup: initial loops to be considered as ‘warmup’ :param mode: generator mode :param data_queue: data queue where generator output is posted line by line :type generator_run_handler: str :type generator_cpus: str :type controller_ip: str :type controller_port: int :type threads: int :type sw_per_thread: int :type switches: int :type thr_delay_ms: int :type traf_delay_ms: int :type ms_per_test: int :type internal_repeats: int :type hosts: int :type warmup: int :type mode: int :type data_queue: multiprocessing.Queue

stress_test.generator_utils.rebuild_generator(generator_build_handler)[source]¶

Rebuilds the generator.

Parameters:generator_build_handler – filepath to the handler that builds the

generator :type generator_build_handler: str

stress_test.generator_utils.run_generator(generator_run_handler, generator_cpus, controller_ip, controller_port, threads, sw_per_thread, switches, thr_delay_ms, traf_delay_ms, ms_per_test, internal_repeats, hosts, warmup, mode, data_queue=None)[source]¶

Runs a generator instance

Parameters:
  • generator_run_handler – generator run handler
  • generator_cpus – cpu ids we assign to generator (comma separated)
  • controller_ip – controller IP for OpenFlow connection
  • controller_port – controller port for OpenFlow connection
  • threads – number of generator threads
  • sw_per_thread – number of switches per thread
  • switches – number of total switches
  • thr_delay_ms – delay between thread creation (in milliseconds)
  • traf_delay_ms – delay between last thread creation and traffic

transmission (in milliseconds) :param ms_per_test: test duration of a single generator loop :param internal_repeats: number of generator loops :param hosts: number of simulated hoss :param warmup: initial loops to be considered as ‘warmup’ :param mode: generator mode :param data_queue: data queue where generator output is posted line by line the generator process will run. :type generator_run_handler: str :type generator_cpus: str :type controller_ip: str :type controller_port: int :type threads: int :type sw_per_thread: int :type switches: int :type thr_delay_ms: int :type traf_delay_ms: int :type ms_per_test: int :type internal_repeats: int :type hosts: int :type warmup: int :type mode: int :type data_queue: multiprocessing.Queue

mininet_utils Module¶

Mininet-related utilities

stress_test.mininet_utils.copy_mininet_handlers(mininet_ssh_server_ip, mininet_user, mininet_pass, mininet_source, mininet_target, remote_port=22)[source]¶

Copies Mininet handlers on the remote Mininet node

Parameters:mininet_ssh_server_ip – IP address of the ssh server on the Mininet

node :param mininet_user: username for the Mininet node :param mininet_pass: password for the Mininet node :param mininet_source: folder with Mininet handlers :param mininet_target: folder where Mininet handlers will be copied :param remote_port: port for mininet_ssh_server_ip :type mininet_ssh_server_ip: str :type mininet_user: str :type mininet_pass: str :type mininet_folder: str :type remote_port: int

stress_test.mininet_utils.delete_mininet_handlers(mininet_ssh_server_ip, mininet_user, mininet_pass, mininet_folder, remote_port=22)[source]¶

Cleans up Mininet handlers on the remote Mininet node

Parameters:mininet_ssh_server_ip – IP address of the ssh server on the Mininet

node :param mininet_user: username for the Mininet node :param mininet_pass: password for the Mininet node :param mininet_folder: folder with Mininet handlers :param remote_port: port for mininet_ssh_server_ip :type mininet_ssh_server_ip: str :type mininet_user: str :type mininet_pass: str :type mininet_folder: str :type remote_port: int

stress_test.mininet_utils.init_mininet_topo(mininet_init_topo_handler, mininet_rest_server_host, mininet_rest_server_port, controller_ip, controller_port, mininet_topology_type, mininet_size, mininet_group_size, mininet_group_delay_ms, mininet_hosts_per_switch)[source]¶

Locally calls the Mininet handler that remotely initializes a topology on a remote Mininet node

Parameters:mininet_init_topo_handler – full path of the handler to initialize

the mininet topology :param mininet_rest_server_host: hostname/IP the REST server listens to :param mininet_rest_server_port: port the REST server listens to :param controller_ip: controller IP :param controller_port: controller OpenFlow port :param mininet_topology_type: Type of the network topology. It can have one of the following values (DisconnectedTopo,LinearTopo or MeshTopo) :param mininet_size: Size of the mininet tpology :param mininet_group_size: Size of the mininet Group :param mininet_group_delay_ms: Delay in which mininet groups are initialized :param mininet_hosts_per_switch: Number of Hosts each mininet switch is attached to :type mininet_init_topo_handler: str :type mininet_rest_server_host: str :type mininet_rest_server_port: int :type controller_ip: str :type controller_port: int :type Topology: str :type mininet_size: int :type mininet_group_size: int :type mininet_group_delay: int :type mininet_hosts_per_switch: int :type start_topo_command: list<str>

stress_test.mininet_utils.start_mininet_server(mininet_ssh_session, mininet_server_remote_path, mininet_rest_server_host, mininet_rest_server_port)[source]¶

Remotely boots a REST server on the Mininet node over an SSH connection

Parameters:
  • mininet_ssh_session – ssh session used to issue remote command
  • mininet_server_remote_path – path where mininet_custom_boot.py is

stored and used to start the mininet topology. :param mininet_rest_server_host: hostname/IP the REST server should listen to :param mininet_rest_server_port: port the REST server should listen to :type mininet_ssh_session: ssh connection object :type mininet_server_remote_path: str :type mininet_rest_server_host: str :type mininet_rest_server_port: int

report_spec Module¶

Contains data structure of report element and tables inside the report. These are used to generate the html report

class stress_test.report_spec.ReportSpec(config_json, results_json, title, config_tables, results_table)[source]¶

Bases: object

Contains the specification of the html report, the title of the report, the json files of the configuration and data and the lists of tables to be generated in the report.

class stress_test.report_spec.TableSpec(table_type, title, keys, source_json, ordering_key=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Contains the rendering information for the tables of the html report.

sb_active_cbench Module¶

sb_idle_cbench Module¶

Idle Southbound Performance test

stress_test.sb_idle_cbench.get_report_spec(test_type, config_json, results_json)[source]¶

It returns all the information that is needed for the generation of the report for the specific test.

Parameters:test_type – describes the type of the specific test. This value

defines the title of the html report. :param config_json: this is the filepath to the configuration json file. :param results_json: this is the filepath to the results json file. :returns: A ReportSpec object that holds all the test report information and is passed as input to the generate_html() function in the html_generation.py, that is responsible for the report generation. :rtype: ReportSpec :type: test_type: str :type: config_json: str :type: results_json: str

stress_test.sb_idle_cbench.sb_idle_cbench_run(out_json, ctrl_base_dir, sb_gen_base_dir, conf, output_dir)[source]¶

Run test. This is the main function that is called from nstat_orchestrator and performs the specific test.

Parameters:
  • out_json (str) – the JSON output file
  • ctrl_base_dir (str) – controller base directory
  • sb_gen_base_dir (str) – generator base directory
  • conf (str) – JSON configuration dictionary
  • output_dir (str) – directory to store output files

sb_idle_mininet Module¶

Idle Southbound Performance test

stress_test.sb_idle_mininet.get_report_spec(test_type, config_json, results_json)[source]¶

It returns all the information that is needed for the generation of the report for the specific test.

Parameters:test_type – Describes the type of the specific test. This value

defines the Title of the html report. :param config_json: this is the filepath to the configuration json file. :param results_json: this is the filepath to the results json file. :returns: A ReportSpec object that holds all the test report information and is passed as input to the generate_html() function in the html_generation.py, that is responsible for the report generation. :rtype: ReportSpec :type: test_type: str :type: config_json: str :type: results_json: str

stress_test.sb_idle_mininet.sb_idle_mininet_run(out_json, ctrl_base_dir, mininet_base_dir, conf, output_dir)[source]¶

Run test. This is the main function that is called from nstat_orchestrator and performs the specific test.

  • out_json (str) – the JSON output file
  • ctrl_base_dir (str) – controller base directory
  • mininet_base_dir (str) – mininet base directory

  • output_dir (str) – directory to store output files
